item.title: The Value of a Moment
item.description:
The Value of a Moment

WARNING: Reading this and the moment to follow may change your life may for ever. It will only take a few moments to read these words - possibly only as long as the exposure on the epic photo of Yosemite, you'd have to ask Preston. What value do you place on this moment in history?

item.title: Introducing Anchor
item.description:
Introducing Anchor 

It’s like the intersection of Twitter (a micro-blogging platform), voicemail (or those short voice recordings you can send via iMessage), and texting/messaging.

I just published "Anchors Away - I'm Hooked" https://medium.com/@nac/anchors-away-i-m-hooked-2175460fc2c3#.1lfhsas3x ... @Anchor #socialmedia #Anchor

item.title: Simon Sinek on Why to Live a More Generous and Sincere Life
item.description:
Simon Sinek on Why to Live a More Generous and Sincere Life

Watch all Simon Sinek Capture Your Flag interviews: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0F0B345720658BFB In Chapter 1 of 23 in his 2013 Capture Your Flag interview, author and public speaker Simon Sinek answers "How Are Your Aspirations Changing As Your Experience Grows?" Sinek notes how early in his career his aspirations were about personal achievements and goals.

item.title: Maven, Connector, or Salesperson: What's Your Archetype? * Productive Flourishing
item.description:
Maven, Connector, or Salesperson: What's Your Archetype? * Productive Flourishing

In the book The Tipping Point, author Malcolm Gladwell talks about three different archetypes of people: mavens, connectors, and salespeople. If you're a changemaker, this framework can help you see why you work the way you do.

item.title: The Value of Time
item.description:
The Value of Time

Lately I've been thinking a lot about the value of time. One of the psalmists of ancient Israel prays that God would "teach us to number our days". Regardless of your world-view, the practice of numbering your days - for me today is 16,256 - can be a very powerful and humbling thing.

item.title: The 3 Most Harmful Addictions (Hint: 2 probably apply to you) - Part 1
item.description:
The 3 Most Harmful Addictions (Hint: 2 probably apply to you) - Part 1

You are addicted and probably don't even realize it. I didn't until I started feeling the incredible clarity as well as the withdrawal symptoms of getting off the most subtle of the 3. "The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and amonthly salary." ― Nassim Nicholas Taleb. 1.

item.title: it can be hard to remember that the digital revolution is still in its early days
item.description:
it can be hard to remember that the digital revolution is still in its early days

Raising your Digital Quotient from the McKinsey Quarterly. Read more here: http://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/strategy-and-corporate-finance/our-insights/raising-your-digital-quotient
